Richard Siegel Foundation approves 2020 scholarships and grants

Rutherford County Schools, graduates beneficiaries of more than $182,642 in scholarship, grant money from foundation

August 28, 2020

Rutherford County Schools

The Richard Siegel Foundation recently approved scholarships in the amount of $72,500 for graduating seniors of Rutherford County and another $110,142 for grant requests benefiting Rutherford County Schools.

More than $51,500 of the grant will go directly to schools, which submitted grant proposals in the summer for various projects. Those schools are Buchanan Elementary, Christiana Elementary, David Youree Elementary, Wilson Elementary, Whitworth-Buchanan Middle, Riverdale High, Rockvale High and Siegel High schools.

The remaining $58,546 in grant money will be donated to organizations that benefit the children of Rutherford County Schools.

MTSU nutrition courses offer high schoolers food for thought, possible career path

BY Gina Logue
MTSU News

August 10, 2020

An MTSU program will enable high school students to take courses this fall that will introduce them to the study of nutrition.

One of the classes is “Nutrition across the Life Span,” which typically is taken in the sophomore year. Students take the exam in May after completing the high school class, and students who pass receive credit for MTSU’s “Principles of Nutrition” class.

The other class, “Nutrition Science and Diet Therapy,” typically is taken in the junior year. This class can be taken for dual enrollment and aligns with MTSU’s “Nutrition for the Health Sciences” class. As well as offering free college credit, completing dual enrollment classes may help students qualify for graduation with honors or distinction.

Blackman, Stewarts Creek grads awarded Blackman Community Club scholarships

June 9, 2020

Rutherford County Schools

The Blackman Community Club recently awarded a pair of scholarships to graduates from Blackman and Stewarts Creek high schools.

Blackman graduate Jacob Brennan along with Stewarts Creeks graduate Morgan Herring each received $750 scholarships from the Blackman Community Club. Brennan will major in education at Hardeman University, while Herring will be attending University of Tennessee – Chattanooga and majoring in physical therapy.

The annual scholarships are awarded to one graduating senior from Blackman and Stewarts Creek; however, the club also considers students who have complete a homeschool curriculum, attended Central Magnet or a Christian-based school and live in the Blackman community.

The scholarships are intended for those who are planning to further their education at a university, college or technical school.

More information is available by visiting their website at www.blackmancommunityclub.com.

PHOTOS PROVIDED

Rutherford County Schools

Oakland High School senior Joshua Jones was recently named the local level Boys and Girls Club Youth of the Year for 2020.

His speech is titled ‘Leading by Example.’

Stewarts Creek club finishes first in state of Tennessee, qualifies for national match

March 4, 2020

Rutherford County Schools

The First Team Air Rifle club at Stewarts Creek High School finished first in the Tennessee regional qualifications for the JR. Olympic Match.

The team — Logan Chapman, Zachary Parsons, Jared Redito, Anthony Lamantia and Abby Highfill — has now qualified for the National Jr Olympic Match this summer at Camp Perry in Ohio.

Head coach Joel Payne will be requesting funding from the 7th Brigade to help with expenses of traveling to Ohio for the national event. There are no seniors on this year’s team and as good as they’ve performed, Payne expects them to be that much better a year from now.

The regional event was recently held at Montgomery Bell Academy in Nashville.

This is James Evans with Rutherford County Schools. We’re sure you are aware, but there is the potential for snow in tomorrow’s forecast.

We are closely monitoring the forecast, but as you know, snow predictions in Middle Tennessee are often unreliable. We will continue monitoring the weather through the evening and overnight, and if there are any changes to tomorrow’s schedule, we will let you know immediately.

As always, thanks for all you do and have a good evening.

HOOP DREAMS

Nov. 5, 2019

By KEITH RYAN CARTWRIGHT
Rutherford County Schools

More than 6,500 fourth- and fifth-graders representing every elementary school in Rutherford County cheered on the Middle Tennessee Blue Raiders men’s basketball team in their season-opening 119-61 win over Maryville.

Five hundred teachers, administrators and chaperones joined the students and bused over to the Murphy Center from their respective schools.

Halftime featured a game of musical chairs that started with one student representing each of the elementary schools, while a second student from the schools gathered in the tunnel to greet the Blue Raiders as they returned to the floor for the second-half of play.

It is the fourth consecutive year the Blue Raiders athletic department has hosted Rutherford County Schools.

PHOTOS / KEITH RYAN CARTWRIGHT
